summary.para: Wind Zones add realism to the trees you create by making them wave their branches and leaves as if blown by the wind.
Note: This only works with trees created by the tree creator or imported from SpeedTree Modeler.
Modes a Wind Zone can have, either Spherical or Directional.

You can have more than one Spherical Wind Zone in a scene, but it does not make much sense to have more than one Directional Wind Zone in your scene as it affects the whole scene. This Wind Zone Mode is used by the WindZone.mode member.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.WindZone.mode
member.summary: Defines the type of wind zone to be used (Spherical or Directional).

member.name: P:UnityEngine.WindZone.radius
member.summary: Radius of the Spherical Wind Zone (only active if the WindZoneMode is set to Spherical).

summary.para: It produces a softly changing wind Pressure.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.WindZone.windPulseFrequency
member.summary: Defines the frequency of the wind changes.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.WindZone.windPulseMagnitude
member.summary: Defines ow much the wind changes over time.

summary.para: Produces a rapidly changing wind pressure.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.WindZoneMode.Directional
member.summary: Wind zone affects the entire scene in one direction.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.WindZoneMode.Spherical
member.summary: Wind zone only has an effect inside the radius, and has a falloff from the center towards the edge.
